ISSUE.TITLE: [>=1.5.0] Docker pipeline unable to start / is stalled.
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: Using Drone with the command `docker run --volume=/var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock --volume=/var/lib/drone:/data --env-file=./drone.env --publish=80:80 --publish=443:443 --restart=always --name=drone drone/drone:1.5.0` causes all new builds to stall / hang and not even start when pushing a new commit (from GitHub). Using the UI and going into a stalled build, it just shows the name of the pipeline, and does not show the individual steps of the pipeline like it used to. Downgrading to 1.4.0 allows pipelines to run as normal when pushing a new commit.
